definition:
A [*Shantha prime*]{} $p$ is a prime number of the form $p = 3^q - 2$
with $q$ being a . The smallest Shantha prime is $7 = 3^2 - 2$. The next
is $3^{541} - 2$ and has 259 digits. Shantha primes are very rare among
the smaller numbers. The above formulation generates mostly composite
numbers.

[1]{} A. K. Devaraj, “Euler’s Generalization of Fermat’s Theorem-A
Further Generalization”, in [*Proceedings of Hawaii International
Conference on Statistics, Mathematics & Related Fields*]{}, 2004.
